blog.description:
Just a tumblr for the movies (film or televised: mini-series, one-off shows..) I've seen.
My original blog (seen-on-the-screen) was regretfully lost with the password change of 2016 since I had used a throwaway email that was erased after 2 years of unuse. So this is my Phoenix Project as I try to rebuild what was lost.

summary: Sorry, this isn’t from your list, but could you do a Thorbruce fic where Thor loses a bit of control with his powers when doing...
question: Sorry, this isn’t from your list, but could you do a Thorbruce fic where Thor loses a bit of control with his powers when doing fluffy intimate stuff with Bruce?  I love your writing btw <3
answer:
That’s fine, thank you!! I loved writing this aaaah

Thor was falling asleep on the sofa when Bruce walked into their little apartment. Bruce walked up to the sofa, reaching down and brushing his hand over Thor’s cheek. Thor’s eyes flickered open and he smiled up at Bruce, taking his hand.

‘You’re back,’ he said, tugging at Bruce’s hand. Bruce went along with it, flopping down on top of Thor.

‘How was your evening?’ asked Bruce.

‘Better, now that you’re here,’ answered Thor, as he weaved a hand through Bruce’s hair. Bruce smiled, and kissed Thor. His hands cupped the side of Thor’s face and Thor made a pleased noise, wrapping his arms around Bruce as he deepened the kiss.

Thor rubbed Bruce’s back, and suddenly, Bruce felt a little tingle through his body and he pulled away from Thor.

Bruce frowned. ‘Did you- did you just electrocute me?’

‘Uh,’ Thor answered. ‘I, uh, hoped you didn’t notice that.’

‘Did you really electrocute me?’ Bruce asked.

‘By accident!’ Thor said. ‘I’m sorry, I just got… excited, I suppose.’

Bruce laughed, and placed a couple of kisses on Thor’s face. ‘You’re so weird.’

‘It won’t happen again,’ said Thor. ‘I’m sorry.’

‘It’s okay,’ Bruce replied with a grin. ‘It’s cute that you’re excited.’

‘Is it?’ said Thor with a smile, and pulled Bruce down for another, proper kiss. ‘Then I won’t hold back.’

Bruce leaned his forehead against Thor’s. ‘Don’t.’
answer_abstract:
That’s fine, thank you!! I loved writing this aaaah

Thor was falling asleep on the sofa when Bruce walked into their little apartment. Bruce walked up to the sofa, reaching down and brushing his hand over Thor’s cheek. Thor’s eyes flickered open and he smiled up at Bruce, taking his hand.

‘You’re back,’ he said, tugging at Bruce’s hand. Bruce went along with it, flopping down on top of Thor.

blog.name: newx-menfan
blog.title: Marvel Comics: Bring Back The New X-Men
blog.description:
Fan Petition to have Marvel bring back New X-Men: Academy X

Petition at Change.org <https://www.change.org/p/marvel-bring-back-the-new-x-men>

tags: not going to tag every character sorry!
summary: Apart from the New X-Men, who are your favorite mutants?
question: Apart from the New X-Men, who are your favorite mutants?
answer:
I really love X-Men as a whole; from Claremont to Morrison! (I haven’t been as big a fan of recent X-books because it’s either poorly made copies of previous BETTER storylines or badly conceived MEGA EVENTS- all the heart and ingenuity have been slowly strangled away by Marvel…).

-I was a hardcore Rogue fan growing up! She was the character that originally got me into reading X-Men comics. Not so much anymore, because I don’t think Rogue has been well written since the 90’s.

-I’m a huge Emma fan, especially Morrison’s Emma!

-I LOVE Claremont’s Storm, but I think she’s oftentimes too complex for other writers to write well.

-I’m still a big Wolverine fan; despite him being oversaturated, origin retconned too much, and has been going downhill over the years.
It’s funny, because when I went to see ‘Logan’, I was really reminded of how great Logan is when he’s written WELL.

-I LOVE BOOM BOOM; don’t get me wrong, I like Jubilee but Tabitha IS my rebellious mall rat!

- Gambit is another favorite when he’s well written. I started out as a ROMY fan, but I slowly learned to love both characters individually, especially after their relationship became really unhealthy and toxic…

-Nocenti’s Longshot is adorable! Rita/Spiral is also one of my heartbreaking favorites…

- I like Banshee, because he’s just kind of the ‘chill’ X-Men.

- Nightcrawler is so much fun; I really enjoy how Kurt is just like 'I want to be a dashingly suave hero!’ and more or less does it.

- 80’s and 90’s fun loving Beast is great; modern Hank McCoy sucks in my opinion…

-Kitty is great when written well; the problem is too many male writers use her as 'the perfect woman’ insert and it gets a little creepy…

-Magneto is just the best; whether it’s being a melodramatic scenery chewing villain, a morally ambiguous complex villain, or concerned headmaster- he’s just such a great character!

- I love CLAREMONT’s Mystique, Destiny, Magik, Callisto, and Rachel Grey- sadly, I kind of view him as the only writer who writes these characters well.

- It’s funny, for years I’ve asked myself; why does Colossus keep being pushed so heavily in comic books- he’s boring!
And then I watched 'Deadpool’ and was reminded how great Piotr can be WHEN WRITTEN WELL.
He’s a excellent character, he just hasn’t been handled well in years and you can easily forget how great he was.

-I love Peter David’s X-Factor as a team, even though the writer is problematic. It’s one of the best modern X-comic books in my opinion! I’m also a huge Layla Miller fan!

-I really LOVE petty overdramatic characters; Northstar and
Quicksilver are my favorites because of this.

-I love pretty much every New Mutant character, with Dani being my favorite. Doug, Warlock, Roberto, Xi'an, etc; they are just all so great. It was just an entire lineup of excellent characters, similar to Academy X.

-I’m a big Morrison fan for the most part, and kind of enjoy some of his weirder characters like Beak or Angel Salvador.

- I love Meggan from Excalibur!

-Cyclops is one of those characters that depending on the writer I either really like or really dislike. He’s my favorite character in XM Evolution, and I love his flawed portrayal in Morrison. Yet I really dislike 90’s comics Cyclops. While not my favorite, I’m okay with Claremont Scott.

-Jean is kind of the same; I either really like her or really dislike her depending on the writer. I disliked how Jean was written in the 90’s, but I loved Claremont and Morrison Jean. I hated Bendis’ teen Jean and Ultimate Jean.

-I LOVE Jono, he’s one of my big favorites! I also really liked Synch and Monet!

-I like Bishop when he’s not being thrown under the bus plot wise.

-Oya is great, the problem is her characterization is so inconsistent.

-I love XCU Xavier- comic book and cartoon Xavier…not so much…

-James Proudstar is one of my favorites!

-I really like Forge, who is just so underrated.

-I like Deadpool usually, even though a little bit goes a long way.

-I like Deadpool movie Cable and Domino better than comic book Cable and Domino. I also LOVE Negasonic Teenage Warhead from the movies!

- Sebastian Shaw is one of my favorite 'underrated villains’.

-I’m pretty sure everyone loves Sinister…

- I actually really like Maggot and Marrow; 90’s products they were.

- I also like some of the minor X-Men human characters, like Stevie Hunter or Mariko Yashida.

-Leech and Artie are adorable! I also like Caliban.

-I like Claremont pre-body switch Betsy; her shyness and girly costumes were really cute!

So yeah, there’s A LOT of X-Characters I really love! Usually it comes down to the writing, in the fact that there’s characters I like but only under certain writers and/or decades.

Thanks for the question! ☺️

summary: Demona Hellstrom only appears in literally like one comic but I love her so much

body:
Infinity War Drabble

Happy stood up and walked over to the seven year old little girl known as Y/N Stark.

“Sweetheart, daddy’s going to come home later than expected alright?” He watched as her face dropped.

“But daddy said we could go out for ice cream tonight.” Her bottom lip quivered as she looked up at Happy with tear filled eyes.

“Hey, don’t cry. It’ll be alright. I promise. I’ll take you out for ice cream tonight alright?” Y/N nodded excitedly.

“Alright than, let’s watch a movie together.” Happy smiled and picked her up.

“Yay!” Y/N giggled.

Happy dropped to the ground.

“Happy!? Happy!? What’s happening!?” Y/N yelled frantically.

“I-I do-.” Was the last thing he said before he turned completely to ash.

Y/N fell on her knees. Tears made their way down her small cheeks.

“F.R.I.D.A.Y Call Daddy!” She yelled.

“I am sorry Miss Stark I can not reach him from here.” Came the electronic voice.

“Try harder! Please! Find a way to tell him he needs to come home!” She covered her face and sobbed.

“I have gained Contact of Iron Patriot, would you like to talk to him?”

“Yes!” Y/N yelled as she shook with fear.

Rhodey’s voice came over the speakers.

“Y/N!? Y/N!? What’s wrong sweetie!?” He asked frantically.

“Uncle Happy is gone! Daddy’s gone! Everyone’s gone!” She cried.

“Oh god, alright I’m on my way with Auntie Tasha. Stay where you are and if anything else happens contact us immediately.” There was a click and the called ended.

Y/N sat in the corner of the living room, far away from Happy’s ashes.

Twenty minutes later Rhodey and Natasha ran into the common room.

“Oh Y/N, come here.” Natasha bent down with her arms wide open.

Y/N ran straight to her and held onto her for dear life as she sobbed.

Rhodey looked out the window, hoping Stark would come home for his little girl soon.
